test.support.logging_helper.TestHandler¶

class test.support.logging_helper.TestHandler(matcher)¶

Bases: logging.handlers.BufferingHandler

Initialize the handler with the buffer size.

Attributes

name

acquire()¶

Acquire the I/O thread lock.

addFilter(filter)¶

Add the specified filter to this handler.

close()¶

Close the handler.

This version just flushes and chains to the parent class’ close().

createLock()¶

Acquire a thread lock for serializing access to the underlying I/O.

emit(record)¶

Emit a record.

Append the record. If shouldFlush() tells us to, call flush() to process the buffer.

filter(record)¶

Determine if a record is loggable by consulting all the filters.

The default is to allow the record to be logged; any filter can veto this and the record is then dropped. Returns a zero value if a record is to be dropped, else non-zero.

Changed in version 3.2: Allow filters to be just callables.

flush()¶

Override to implement custom flushing behaviour.

This version just zaps the buffer to empty.

format(record)¶

Format the specified record.

If a formatter is set, use it. Otherwise, use the default formatter for the module.

handle(record)¶

Conditionally emit the specified logging record.

Emission depends on filters which may have been added to the handler. Wrap the actual emission of the record with acquisition/release of the I/O thread lock. Returns whether the filter passed the record for emission.

handleError(record)¶

Handle errors which occur during an emit() call.

This method should be called from handlers when an exception is encountered during an emit() call. If raiseExceptions is false, exceptions get silently ignored. This is what is mostly wanted for a logging system - most users will not care about errors in the logging system, they are more interested in application errors. You could, however, replace this with a custom handler if you wish. The record which was being processed is passed in to this method.

matches(**kwargs)¶

Look for a saved dict whose keys/values match the supplied arguments.

release()¶

Release the I/O thread lock.

removeFilter(filter)¶

Remove the specified filter from this handler.

setFormatter(fmt)¶

Set the formatter for this handler.

setLevel(level)¶

Set the logging level of this handler. level must be an int or a str.

shouldFlush()¶

Should the handler flush its buffer?

Returns true if the buffer is up to capacity. This method can be overridden to implement custom flushing strategies.
